meanings.definition: A person or thing that terminates or ends something.
meanings.sent1: The terminators of the party were the parents who came to pick up their children.
meanings.sent2: The detective was the terminator of the mystery, revealing the culprit.
meanings.sent3: The cake was the terminator of the buffet, disappearing in minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the terminator of his anger, melting it away instantly.
meanings.sent5: The final exam was the terminator of the school year, marking the end of hard work.

meanings.definition: A type of punctuation mark used to indicate the end of a sentence.
meanings.sent1: She always remembered to place a terminator at the end of her sentences.
meanings.sent2: The period is a common terminator found in written language.
meanings.sent3: The exclamation mark was the terminator that added excitement to her story.
meanings.sent4: The question mark acted as a terminator, signaling curiosity in the sentence.
meanings.sent5: The ellipsis was the terminator that left the reader wondering about the missing information.

meanings.definition: A type of machine or device designed to terminate or destroy something.
meanings.sent1: The terminators in the factory efficiently crushed the scrap metal.
meanings.sent2: The military used advanced terminators to neutralize enemy threats.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum was a terminator for dust bunnies, keeping the house clean.
meanings.sent4: The laser cutter acted as a terminator, slicing through the metal effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The antivirus software was the terminator that eradicated the computer virus.
